result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven L. KLEIN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven L. KLEIN

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Payment Plan requested for monthly payment of $75.00; payment plan documents filed with case.

The State moves to amend to count 1 to ordinance disorderly conduct, contrary to Manitowoc County Ordinance 6.19.  Motion granted.
NO CONTEST plea entered to the amended charge.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in count 2.  Motion granted.
The Court imposes a $100.00 forfeiture plus costs, total of $330.50, to be paid by 06-15-15 or 6 days county jail for failure to pay.
Reminder notice mailed to defendant.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with District Attorney set for 04-10-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Plea date is et for 07-14-15 at 2:00 p.m.
Minutes.

ADDRESS INFO for Steven L. KLEIN
Current: 1402 16th Street #11, Two Rivers, WI 54241 United States  (Effective: 03-11-2015)
Prior: 2131 33rd Street, Two Rivers, WI 54241

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of battery-dvo.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 03-16-15 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, maintain absolute sobriety and have no abusive or assaultive contact with Amy Suchocki.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
